sentences.en: "It's of no great literary merit," he said, almost apologetically.
sentences.cn: “它没多大的文学价值，”他近乎愧疚地说道。

sentences.en: By the 1920's, he was lionised by literary London.
sentences.cn: 到了20世纪20年代，他成为伦敦文学界的宠儿。

sentences.en: Camus is considered to be one of the twentieth century's literary giants.
sentences.cn: 加缪被视为20世纪的文学巨匠之一.

sentences.en: He began to churn out literary compositions in English.
sentences.cn: 他开始用英文创作大量的文学作品。

sentences.en: He is highly disdainful of anything to do with the literary establishment.
sentences.cn: 他对任何与文学界权威沾边的事都嗤之以鼻。

sentences.en: He presents his own highbrow literary programme.
sentences.cn: 他介绍了自己那个专业性很强的文学项目的情况。

sentences.en: Her literary criticism focuses on the way great literature suggests ideas.
sentences.cn: 她的文学批评集中关注的是伟大的文学作品表达思想的方式。

sentences.en: His apartment was the most famous literary salon in Russia.
sentences.cn: 他的公寓是俄国最著名的文学沙龙会所。

sentences.en: Many literary academics simply parrot a set of impressive-sounding phrases.
sentences.cn: 许多文人只是机械地模仿一套听上去令人印象深刻的说法。

sentences.en: She's the literary editor of the "Sunday Review".
sentences.cn: 她是《星期天评论》的文学编辑。

sentences.en: The book drew lavish praise from literary critics.
sentences.cn: 文学评论家们对此书好评如潮。

sentences.en: The novel is a thicket of literary references.
sentences.cn: 这本小说纯粹是由一堆文学参考书胡乱拼凑而成。

sentences.en: The period of literary and artistic efflorescence has come.
sentences.cn: 文艺创作的繁盛时期已经来到.

sentences.en: The world which the book inhabits seems too self-consciously literary, too introverted.
sentences.cn: 该书所描绘的世界似乎过分刻意地追求文学性，过于内敛含蓄。

words.tran_cn: 受过教育的；精通文学的
过于推敲；过度讲究的辞句
从事写作的,精通文学的,严格正式的

phrases.tran_cn: 文稿代理人；作者对外事务代理人

trans.tran_cn: 文学的，适于文学作品的，爱好文学的，书面的
